metadata.title: CVE-2024-53432 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
While parsing certain malformed PLY files, PCL version 1.14.1 crashes dueto an uncaught std::out_of_range exception in PCLPointCloud2::at. Thisissue could potentially be exploited to cause a denial-of-service (DoS)attack when processing untrusted PLY files.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-53432` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcl-apps1.8 - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
libpcl-common1.8 - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
libpcl-features1.8 - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
libpcl-filters1.8 - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
libpcl-io1.8 - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
libpcl-kdtree1.8 - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
libpcl-keypoints1.8 - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
libpcl-ml1.8 - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
libpcl-octree1.8 - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
libpcl-outofcore1.8 - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
libpcl-people1.8 - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
libpcl-recognition1.8 - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
libpcl-registration1.8 - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
libpcl-sample-consensus1.8 - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
libpcl-search1.8 - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
libpcl-segmentation1.8 - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
libpcl-stereo1.8 - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
libpcl-surface1.8 - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
libpcl-tracking1.8 - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
libpcl-visualization1.8 - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
pcl-tools - 1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pcl package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.18.04.1+esm1').
